postBodyContent:
You don’t need the whole world to love you, just a few good people.

The Greatest Showman (2017) dir. Michael Gracey

theme 175 by scottisbae. static preview — pastebin or google docs

  • links: 4

they are the last four icons and when you hover them you get a title ( link and tittle are customized in the appearance ). you can change those icons if you want, simple going to font awesome, open the icon you desire and copy the “i class”. to put on the theme, search for the div class “sidebarlinks” and you will find them there ( link 1, link 2, link 3 and link 4  ), change and it’s done. don’t hesitate to ask me to help/do it for you if it’s confusing

you can also use simple links instead of icons, just enable ‘show simple links’ in the appearance

  • all colors, font and font size are customized in the appearance
  • sidebar icons 45px but 100px works just fine. you have the option to use both icons or none
  • if show posts 400px
  • if show borders ( both sidebar and posts)
  • anything you need you can ask me

Like or Reblog.
Don’t remove the credit.
tony stark + dramatically taking off his glasses

we all know capitalism is fucking evil but one of my favorite stories to tell from Retail Hell is that time my district manager got annoyed that 2 poor people were taking food out of the dumpster occasionally so he told us all to start pouring bleach over all the items we threw out so people couldn’t use them/it would hurt them if they touched it directly. never did that and absolutely have participated in “employee theft” by stealing bags of food from the dumpsters to donate to the local food bank but like. he really did just want us to directly harm people over food that was already in the literal trash.

“A lack of diversity feeds discrimination. Why am I the only Indian presenter on mainstream youth entertainment in maybe the last 10 years? It means that people of different races don’t have someone they can relate to. Even in small ways, like dark skinned girls wanting to see what make up looks like on a celebrity that isn’t porcelain white. Even in the most cosmopolitan cities in the world, it’s still hard to see accurate depictions of society on screen and in magazines.“ — Jameela Jamil
